content:
Check:
  all:
    - name: --DY
      operator: empty
    - name: --STDY
      operator: empty
    - name: --ENDY
      operator: empty
Core:
  Id: CDISC.SENDIG.71
  Version: '1'
  Status: Draft
Description: One of --DY, --STDY or --ENDY must be populated
Outcome:
  Message: One of --DY, --STDY or --ENDY must be populated
  Output Variables:
    - --DY
    - --STDY
    - --ENDY
Rule Type: Record Data
Sensitivity: Record
Authorities:
  - Organization: CDISC
    Standards:
      - Name: SENDIG
        Version: '3.1'
        References:
          - Origin: SDTM and SENDIG Conformance Rules
            Rule Identifier:
              Id: '71'
              Version: '1'
            Version: '2.0'
            Citations:
              - Cited Guidance: The Permissible Study Day variables (--DY, --STDY,
                  and --ENDY) describe the relative day of the observation starting
                  with the reference date as Day 1.
                Document: IG v3.1
                Section: 4.4.4
Scope:
  Classes:
    Include:
      - ALL
  Domains:
    Include:
      - ALL

json.Description: One of --DY, --STDY or --ENDY must be populated

Outcome.Message: One of --DY, --STDY or --ENDY must be populated

Citations.Cited_Guidance: The Permissible Study Day variables (--DY, --STDY, and --ENDY) describe the relative day of the observation starting with the reference date as Day 1.
